derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English pott, probably reinforced in Middle English by Old French pot; of unknown ultimate origin (compare with late Latin potus 'drinking cup'). Current senses of the verb date from the early 17th cent
1930s: probably from Mexican Spanish potiguaya 'cannabis leaves'

entry.def: A pot is a deep round container used for cooking stews, soups, and other food.
You can use pot to refer to a teapot or coffee pot.
A pot is a cylindrical container for jam, paint, or some other thick liquid.

example.ex: Hundreds of jam pots lined her scrubbed shelves.
example.tran: 她那擦得干干净净的架子上排列着几百个果酱罐。

entry.def: A pot is the same as a flowerpot .
If you pot a young plant, or part of a plant, you put it into a container filled with soil, so it can grow there.
Pot is sometimes used to refer to the drugs cannabis and marijuana.
If you have pots of money, you have a lot of it.

example.ex: He must have pots of money.

entry.tran: （一盘纸牌游戏中各玩家所下的）赌注总额，全部赌注
entry.def: In a card game, the pot is the money from all the players which the winner of the game will take as a prize.
You can refer to a fund consisting of money from several people as the pot .

example.ex: I've taken some money from the pot for wrapping paper.
example.tran: 我已从公共基金里拿了一些钱买包装纸。

entry.def: Someone who has a pot has a round, fat stomach which sticks out, either because they eat or drink too much, or because they have had very little to eat for some time.
A pot is a deep bowl which a small child uses instead of a toilet.
In the games of snooker and billiards, if you pot a ball, you succeed in hitting it into one of the pockets.

example.ex: He did not pot a ball for the next two frames.
example.tran: 他在接下来的两局中一杆未进。

entry.tran: （因无人照料或经营）垮掉，没落，衰落；荒废
entry.def: If something goes to pot, it loses all its good qualities because nobody looks after it or works at it.

example.ex: The neighbourhood really is going to pot.
example.tran: 这个街区确实在走向败落。

entry.def: If you take pot luck, you decide to do something even though you do not know what you will get as a result.

example.ex: If you haven't made an appointment, take pot luck and knock on the door...
example.tran: 如果你没有预约，就敲门试试运气吧。
他对这种“碰运气”的方法不屑一顾。

means.word_mean: 1. metal or earthenware cooking vessel that is usually round and deep; often has a handle and lid
2. a plumbing fixture for defecation and urination
3. the quantity contained in a pot
4. a container in which plants are cultivated
5. (often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent;

sentences.sentence: "he made a mint on the stock market"

means.word_mean: 6. the cumulative amount involved in a game (such as poker)
8. a resistor with three terminals, the third being an adjustable center terminal; used to adjust voltages in radios and TV sets

example.en: Why don't you bum some good chow for us，dear grease pot?
example.zh: 大厨师，你干嘛不烧些好菜给我们吃吃？

list.explanation: 随意地，有啥吃啥(常指吃便饭)

example.en: Come on and dine pot luck.

slang.tokens: Shit or get off the pot.

list.explanation: (常用于表示不满或提出要求)不能举棋不定。应当机立断

example.en: The union leader wamed that the city had until Feb. 1 to shit or get off the pot.
example.zh: 工会领抽警告说，市政当局在2月1日之前必须作出决定。

And when that is failed, they stop the hunters, banging on pots and pans to alert the deer.
Why do local animal rights people bang on pots and pans

sentences.en: He debated heating up the pot first before his friends came.
sentences.cn: 他考虑在朋友们到来之前先把火锅烧热。

sentences.en: A full tea set like this consists of a pot and eight cups.
sentences.cn: 像这样的全套茶具由一个壶和八个杯子组成。

jushi.english: She stirred the pot until all the sugar added had melted.
jushi.chinese: 她不断搅动锅,直到加的糖全部溶化为止。

jushi.english: Housewives used to keep milk cool by covering the bottle with a stone pot.
jushi.chinese: 过去家庭主妇们常用石钵罩住奶瓶,防止牛奶变热。

jushi.english: He filled the pot with earth and planted a rose in it.
jushi.chinese: 他在花盆里填上土,栽了株玫瑰。
